tn.text: These are the names of men. (See: [[ en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Do you really think that ... you?
tn.text: The leaders use a question to suggest to the king that he should not trust David. AT: "You are wrong to think that ... you!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
to secretly learn information about someone else
The leaders use a question to suggest to the king that he should not trust David. AT: "You need to know that David ... overthrow it." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Here "it" refers to the city which represents the people who live there. AT: "in order to conquer us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "the city" refers to Rabbah, the capital city of the Ammonites.
This act was meant as an insult to humiliate the men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "deeply" is an idiom that means "very." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
It is understood that they should return to Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: they had become a stench to David
tn.text: The phrase "become a stench" is a metaphor for "they had become offensive." AT: "they had become offensive like a bad smell to David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: twenty thousand ... a thousand ... twelve thousand
tn.text: "20,000 ... 1,000 ... 12,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Here "the city" refers to Rabbah, the capital city of the Ammonites.
The battle with the Arameans and Ammon continues.

tn.ref: As for the rest of the army, he gave it into the command of Abishai his brother
tn.text: "He put Abishai his brother in charge of the rest of the army"
Joab gets the army ready for battle.

tn.ref: for me, then you, Abishai, must rescue me
tn.text: Here "me" refers to Joab who represents his soldiers. Also, Abishai represents his soldiers. AT: "for us, then you, Abishai, and your army must rescue us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here Abishai represents his soldiers. AT: "from Abishai and his soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "the city" refers to Rabbah, the capital city of the Ammonites.
"and returned to Jerusalem"

tn.ref: When the Arameans saw that they were being defeated by Israel
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when the Arameans realized that the Israelites were defeating them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means the east side of the Euphrates River.
Here "came to" can be translated as "went to" or "gathered at" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_go]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This phrase refers to a position of authority. AT: "leading them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "When David heard about this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "Israel" represents the army of Israel. AT: "assembled all the army of Israel together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Translate these names as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:10:15|10:16]].
Here David represents his soldiers. AT: "against David and his soldiers and fought them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here David represents his soldiers. AT: "David and his soldiers killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"700 ... 40,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Shobach the commander of their army was wounded and died there
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Israelites wounded Shobach the commander of the Aramean army, and he died there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Translate these names as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:10:15|10:16]].

tn.ref: saw that they were defeated by Israel
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "realized that the Israelites had defeated them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
